text: Guy Henry Ourisson (March 26, 1926 - November 4, 2006) was a French chemist. He was vice president and later president of the Academy of Sciences. ==Career== In 1952 he got a PhD from Harvard University. In 1954, he got a doctorate in physics from the Sorbonne under the direction of G. Dupont. At the University of Strasbourg, he was appointed as a lecturer in 1955, professor in 1958. He became a retired professor in 1995. He died, aged 80, in Strasbourg. Category:2003 deaths Category:1926 births Category:French chemists
title: Guy Ourisson
